CatDescriptText: Mrs. William Lane, housewife, Homewood and Mr. William R. Bauer, self-employed businessman, Mt. Lebanon, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 2, 1960, pg. A1 question reads: Do you think religion will play a major part in the choosing of the presidential candidate? If so, why?" Lane's answer reads: "It shouldn't and I don't think it will.  People are pretty broad-minded, and they won't be concerned so much about religion as they will about how the candidate stands on other issues." Bauer's answer reads: "I Hope not, but I think that it is bound to play a part.  The reason is there are too many prejudices-both concerning race and religion."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Mrs. William Lane wearing dress with wide light colored collar and "E" shaped brooch, standing in front of C.A. Michel store window, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of William R. Bauer wearing diamond patterned necktie, standing in front of C.A. Michel store window, Smithfield Street, Downtown
